title: EconomicEvent
description: An inflow or outflow of an economic resource in relation to a process and/or exchange.

action.description: Relates a process input or output to a verb, such as consume, produce, work, improve, etc.

affectedQuantity.description: The quantity and unit of the event. This is the quantity that could be used to increment or decrement a resource, depending on the type of resource and type of event.

affects.description: The economic resource that is decremented or incremented by the economic event, or just what the economic event is about.

provider.description: The economic agent from whom the economic event is initiated.

receiver.description: The economic agent whom the economic event is for.

start.description: The starting date and optionally time of the economic event.

duration.description: The observed duration of the economic event.

inputOf.description: The process for which this economic event describes an input.

outputOf.description: The process for which this economic event describes an output.

fulfills.description: References a commitment which is completely or partially fulfilled by an economic event.

creates.description: References a commitment that was fully or partially created because of the economic event, often based on a prior agreement.

appreciationOf.description: The economic event being appreciated (gift economy).

appreciationWith.description: The economic event implemented in appreciation (gift economy).

under.description: Reference to an agreement between agents which specifies the rules or policies which govern this event.
